Reviews.Title: “Barely Slept”
Reviews.Author: RamadaGurl
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a place to stay if they put you on the 1st floor. We were put on the 1st floor, and there is a dance club underneath our room. The music was loud, and vibrated our floor until 4am.I if I had known this prior to booking it I would have paid more and stay somewhere else. When I stay at a hotel I expect to get some sleep. Never again would I stay there, and I'm warning all I know about this. It's terrible that they allow their guest to have to put up with this!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Madalina T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada 3 nights on April 2012 (I just returned), and my experience could not have been any better. I was very warmly greeted upon my arrival, and the staff made sure I will have everything I need throughout my stay. The room was very nice and clean. Everybody was so kind, recommending restaurants, local attractions, and providing excellent guidance and directions throughout my stay. Mihaela and Ruxandra were so warm and professional, they made me feel like I was home (and this rarely, if ever happens when I stay at hotels). They helped me arrange a trip to Victoria, and find my way around downtown, and overall make me feel welcome in their hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to stay in the downtown area, and wants quality for their money. Many thanks, Mihaela, Ruxandra, Derrick, Bruno, Calin!!! Madalina

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Thor B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2012 with my girlfriend and we both were very satisfied. Very kind and helpful staff , clean and spacious room , a lovely bathroom. Close to main attractions. Overall, a great hotel to stay at when you're visiting Vancouver, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend away.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret S
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at the Ramada with my sister who was visiting from England. The staff were so good to us. Recommended lots of attractions and restaurants. The hotel was so perfectly located to be able to wander around Vancouver. The General Manager, Ruxandra was so kind and arranged a trip to Victoria for us. We thoroughly enjoyed our weekend of catching up. Thank you Ramada!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: heart
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and knowledgeable staff make this place Very Good. We had help with luggage storage since we arrived early - then our luggage was taken to our room. All of the staff's recommendations for restaurants and transportation were spot-on. Room was small but clean with a large bathroom. Noise was not a factor - possibly since we requested a quiet room away from the nightclub noise. Price was reasonable compared to other downtown hotels. Fairly far from the convention center but close to many restaurants and night life.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: southislandgurl
Reviews.Content: Everyone is always so nice when I stay (the whole 2 times I've been) Location is great, staff is friendly and helpful, rooms have been remodeled, the granite is a nice touch. This hotel is great bang for the buck. Anyone who complains must be expecting the 4 Seasons, because this hotel has everything you need and at a great price. I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Bernice B
Reviews.Content: Smells like a brothel from 30 years ago, $250 'smoking' deposit has to be put down in addition to your room fee, and it's in a terrible neighbourhood. Pay the extra money and go ANYWHERE else.

Reviews.Title: “Always Great!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyJ768
Reviews.Content: Always so great to be back in Vancouver and especially at the Ramada. The staff are always so friendly and happy to see you again. The hotel is in a great location that is so easy to get everywhere. Rooms are comfortable and I always sleep well. Thanks to Ruxandra the GM always good to see you.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Carly T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in early March, in a queen room. The room was tiny, I'd be surprised if there was a meter of space around the bed, and the view from our window was of walls and other hotel room windows. There was a coffee maker, and the bathroom was spacious. Despite it's size, the room was nice. The hallways were undergoing renovation but this did not impact us. The staff were nice and helpful, and the hotel location was good - easy to catch the bus outside to anywhere you want to go, and we walked to Granville Island Market. I think for the size of room, this place should be a bit cheaper than it was, but overall it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Ones of the best places I stayed in. Great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: Great location. For everyone saying that this hotel is noisy, that's like going to the Las Vegas strip and complaining about the noise. If you don't want to be somewhere noisy then book a hotel away from Granville Street. I Will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: My night at this hotel was great. The check in staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast in the quirky Massey Pub restaurant. The cook and server were professional and enjoyable. The location is ideal as it is surrounded by lots of shopping, good food and cozy places to have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: vancity_wds
Reviews.Content: had some family stay here for a few days because it was near by and my place was to small to accommodate them, they had no complaints and Brandy was especially courteous to us all.

Reviews.Title: “Secret Discounted Rooms Available!”
Reviews.Author: OsitoNombre
Reviews.Content: Learned the most helpful secret ever! If you're ever in the city and going out for a night in the town, I learned how to get a huge discount at this place. Simply tell the staff you're out here to party and they'll give you a room that is affected by their neighboring club with a huge discount. It's actually a really nice place too. I'm assuming they have a limited number of these discounted rooms, but an amazing deal, if you can grab one. Totally hitting this up everytime from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Drew674
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every time I come to Vancouver. It's close to many amenities and great restaurants and shopping. I normally come to Vancouver every couple of months and decided a few years back to give it a try and have been faithful ever since. The staff are friendly, The Morrissey is a great pub and Ginger62 brings in many amazing DJ's. I will agree with some of the feedback, that the noise is loud. However, they always warn me of it, and I'm a heavy sleeper, so I don't mind taking a room over the club. I highly recommend the Ramada if you are looking for a reasonable rate and a place to stay in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, very smelly, Loud bass from clubs”
Reviews.Author: Yyzbased
Reviews.Content: Old hotel, very dated interiors, bad lighting in rooms, view from the windows...you are looking at the fire wells, worst part is that it is currently 0150 in the morning and the bass from the clubs has kept me up the past two hours. Front desk can do nothing about it.

Reviews.Title: “one night stay :-)”
Reviews.Author: Adam E
Reviews.Content: Well i had a pre paid visa and for some reason it did'nt want to work when i needed to pay the bill so we could get our room my girl friend and i, so i tryed and tryed with the visa a few times still did'nt work, kinda pissed me off and i felt like an idiot, but this wonderful woman named mihaela did'nt lose her cool at all and gave us an option that worked for everyone and made me smile and happy, she does great at her job and is full of smiles and has a wonderful attitude and great work ethics from what i seen, my girl and i want to thank you for helping us and making our stay every thing that we hoped it would be, hope to return again, thank you mihaela, room 209 march 24 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for Yaletown Visit”
Reviews.Author: arenamama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property Feb29-March 4th, 2012. The room was clean but very small with two double beds. For someone who is not expecting luxury, but just a place to sleep, this hotel fits the bill. Our room was at the back of the hotel and we had no problem with noise except for Saturday night when there was a group conversing in the hallway, but that could happen anywhere. You require a room key to enter the elevator and I felt very safe in spite of the fact that the hotel is on a major road. The bus stops right outside the door of the hotel and it is just a 5 minute walk to the skytrain station that takes you to the airport. We booked on Hotwire and the hotel would not allow us the complimentary breakfast as a result. We were allowed a bigger room, at our insistence. My husband was able to use the complimentary gym facilities at the gym around the corner. We paid $70/night with Hotwire, but could have booked for $84 directly with the hotel and received the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Parking a Vehicle Here - Below Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: biglis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice now. The first time, my son found a bed bug and we were not charged for the stay. The manager apologized profusely and assured us they would get it dealt with and I am sure they did. Wanting to give it a second shot, we made the mistake of staying here again and bringing a car. My son found a used condom under the bed and had to be moved from his room, which was decent enough of the hotel. Beds were OK, rooms OK, TV didn't work in my room and the creamer was actually hard.I have never seen creamer so old that it is hard. The internal fire doors all seemed to be 'sticky'. We stayed on a Friday night and the music noise from the downstairs was really quite bad until very late ( I went to bed at 1.30pm and it was going then ). I am used to loud music and was on the 5th floor , but even I couldn't sleep. The thing that made me most upset though was the following. When we booked in we had to hand the keys to our vehicle over to the desk (they had moved the car 'to make way for other vehicles' in the short space of time it was parked there)Despite the cameras all round the car park and the surveillance screens on the front desk, no one saw a thief breaking into the vehicle and the cameras were not hooked up to video! Not very useful.The cameras gave us a false sense of security, as they turned out to be completely pointless. This all happened in the space of less than 2 hours of being parked there in broad daylight. So my advice is, if you have to stay in downtown Vancouver stay somewhere else.If you have to stay here, do not expect any sort of protection for your vehicle. In fact, if you ask the hotel staff, after the event, they will show you in writing that the vehicles in the car park are not protected by them, even though they have hold of your keys. Yes it is near to everything, yes its reasonably priced, yes the rooms are cleanish and hopefully they dealt with the bug problem. Yes the staff are pleasant enough. BUT beware the drug users scouting out the cars in their car park.They are very swift about their business and the hotel staff did not seem unduly perturbed for us, leaving me to assume they have seen this scenario many times before! **Ramada, pay someone to either actually watch your cameras, video tape it, or employ a guard in the car park. The thieves obviously know you don't, or they would not have tampered with our car in the daytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJmoran
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the beginning of February and was pleasantly surprised on how good the service was. We had a small problem and accidentally got overcharged but the staff fixed the problem very quickly and really went out of their way to make sure we had a good stay there. Mihaela was extremely helpfuI and wouldn't stop until we were more than satisfied. I defiantly recommend staying there. The location is amazing. It sits between a fun bar and a nightclub. The rooms were nice and clean and our overall stay was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beds!”
Reviews.Author: Amber T
Reviews.Content: every time we visit vancouver, we stay at the Ramada Inn & Suites on Granville street. We love the location as it's very convenient to walk pretty much everywhere we want to visit or shop. Also, the bus is easy to catch and the train in only a few quick blocks away. The staff have always been very friendly and accomodating, the rooms are spotless, and the beds are out of this world comfortable. Well done Ramada, keep up the good work :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, large room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: slw2610
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights so wanted to be close to down town/shopping area which was a simple 10 min stroll away. This hotel was situated on a lively street with plenty of entertainment options and local eateries/bars. We had a room on the 6th floor which was very light, spacious with a large clean bathroom. The views onto Yaletown's residential blocks were very pleasant and the hotel was around the corner from some really great independent breakfast eateries. We stayed over a Fri/Sat night so you could hear street noise, but you are in a major city so not sure what some people expect?! Would definitely recommend this hotel when paying an online travel agency lead in rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not all its cracked up to.be”
Reviews.Author: jackorch
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel via a back alley i.was expected to leave my car in it is not the safest or securest of places. Checked in and all staff were very helpful and i was then told that my car would be valeted to a different area! We stayed in room 215 to begin with the room was a little small but clean and tidy and i couldnt complain. Was going to see the canucks play so left the hotel reasonably early! Got back to the hotel at about 11 and returned to my room. All we could hear was very loud music coming from a near by nightclub/pub not only was it the music but the vibration from the bass of the music. We phoned the front desk who told us we should have been informed of this upon booking and check in which we werent. The person at the front desk was quite helpful and after some discussion they offered us a room on the 6th floor. we could still hear the music but not quite as bad and there were no other rooms available. The ramada offered us a complimentary breakfast which also turned out to be pretty poor quality with mouldy toast. As a summery the hotel is not a bad one the staff were very helpful but on a fri or sat night it is a very noisy until 3 or 4 am. hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne L
Reviews.Content: Greet location, steps from everything, great staff and memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, perfect location, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CK17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver at this hotel on Sunday, Feb 26 as we were in town to see a concert that evening. The hotel location was extremely convenient for our purpose. The concert venue (Orpheum Theatre) was only a few blocks down the street (5min walk). Shopping was at our doorstep as well as good coffee shops and restaurants. We are also a very active couple and the hotel's close proximity to the seawall and Stanley Park made it easy for us to get our run training in. The room was clean and well appointed and perfect for what we needed. Our check in and check out process was fast and convenient and we found the staff to be very accomodating and helpful when needed. We would stay at this hotel again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “February 25 th Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hayley F
Reviews.Content: Me and 3 other friends stayed at the Ramada and are stay was wonderful we received an amazing price and parking was very good a swell. Are room was upgraded and it was perfect for the night, Over all are stay was amazing Michaela Birzan was wonderful she was so helpful she will be the main reason me and friends will come and stay again ! Keep up the fantastic work ! Hayley F

Reviews.Title: “service made up for slight tackiness”
Reviews.Author: Pamo26_12
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed two nights at the Ramada. The place could use a face lift and was in a bit of disrepair (masking tape on the door for a room number as an example) The room was a little small, but adequate. As others have indicated, however, the service was well above average. Randy, the concierge was especially attentive. He saw we had bicycles in our car & offered to put them in a storage room & had wonderful restaurant suggestions. He definitely goes the extra mile for his guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel...Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: lizj1987
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel at the beginning of February with my brother, we had paid for a twin room, but when we arrived we were upgraded (at no cost) to a twin room suite, which had a sitting area. The location is great, so close to restaurants, shopping, transport and in the hub of the city centre. The beds were extremely comfortable, and after getting off a 14 hour flight, I slept well! I will definately recommend this hotel to any friends/family travelling to Vancouver in the near future. Thanks again Ramada for making my trip so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: IngGodalming
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada, Granville Street, downtown Vancouver for ease of sightseeing around Vancouver for a couple of days before flying home. The room was very pleasant and clean (only criticism was only one bedside lamp not on both sides) and the position of the hotel was ideal. Loved the breakfast which was very reasonably priced. The hotel front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful especially Brian who went out of his way to adivise us about the buses, trains and points of interest. He even lent us umbrellas when it was raining! Thanks Brian! :) Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aaron D
Reviews.Content: I had a wonder stay at the Ramada with a few of my friends last weekend for my Birthday. This was our second time . I was surprised when we walked in the people working the lobby remembered us and gave us a nice welcome back. When we need an extra towel they brought it up to us in about 5 min. I love service like that. Ms. Michaela also let us know about a few things to do in the city since we are not from there. She helped make our trip as fun as it was.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne L
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all at the Ramada for a great stay in Vancouver! The front desk staff were really helpful especially Raj! and the GM Ruxandra was extremely helpful , all the staff went out of their way to help out! Thanks again guys I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Kayla_Madsen123
Reviews.Content: My group of friends are here in Vancouver for a few nights and we got a good price on the room here at Ramada Inn and Suites. As you check in, they take a security deposit and so we then went up to check our rooms out and get ready to see the city. Later in the evening I decided to check my online banking statements and I saw that the man checking us in accidently with held the security deposit twice. At the time I was quite annoyed and went down there hoping they would be understanding. I was right away greeted with big smiles and they could not have been more helpful. For a busy friday night Mihaela Birzan (The manager) was so kind and understanding about the entire situation. She got on the phone and talked to my bank and cleared everything up. It was an honest mistake and I just really appreciate how great she was in this incident. I will come back because of her and will tell my friends about this hotel. Plus, the location could not be better! This hotel has a great staff, and the manager is the reason for our return Thanks so much Ramada!

Reviews.Title: “strategic location but......”
Reviews.Author: Melisa L
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this inn for 3 weeks. But the linen were replaced only 3 times and the carpet was not vacuumed, I did not know if this was the policy of the management or the problem of the room-service unit. Located in Granville street was so strategic as easy to reach buses, unfortunately there were many beggars and drunk people around the inn as there were so many bars n pubs, which I did not know when booked it through internet. Even on New Year Eve, the drunk residents of opposite room made noise and pounded my room's door that made us (me and my sons) scared, fortunately I used double-locked on the door.

Reviews.Title: “back again, had an even better time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: americaneagle1989
Reviews.Content: came here last year with some buddies. cant believe the guy there remembered me! again rej and the foreign girl were too good to explain it. i would never get service like this back home. canadians are way nicer. lol only reason im saying this is because i felt bad listening to a lady complain to them about how busy it was outside and narrow the streets in the city were and how it made it hard to find parking anywhere their mid sized gmc yukon xl. wtf people. it made me feel ashamed how arrogant some people are! people like her make the world hate americans. nothing bad to say about this place. cant wait to be back

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Carla H
Reviews.Content: great location walking distance to alot of great attractions in Vancouver, nice rooms and wonderful staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tudorache A
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the location, very close to the center of the city. It was great to know that I don't have to rent a car so I had a really great time walking to Granville Island. The staff was very nice and I hope to come back really soon. Congratulation for opening a great hotel in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was an enjoyable time.”
Reviews.Author: Jaaguirre83
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful and the wireless Internet helped out a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, old hotel, interesting neighborhood, stay in after 10p”
Reviews.Author: coloradokd
Reviews.Content: Good location for walking around downtown Vancouver, really close to Granville Island. *Tiny* hotel, room was the size of a single, but had two double beds. Also, the smoke detector started clicking, so we called the front desk. The maintenance person showed up right away, said, "Oh, so the water got down here too!" He took down the smoke detector full of water and didn't replace it while we were there at least. There was also a big wet spot on the floor directly under the smoke detector. On the plus side the bathroom was half the size of the room, and had an excellent shower! Don't plan on walking around this part of Vancouver after 10pm without a large group of people. There is a reason there are bars on all of the stores for a several block radius. Don't choose this hotel for views--it's packed down in between many larger apartment buildings (unless you enjoy people-watching for people in their apartments...). ***The hotel charged a $250 "pending security deposit" to my credit card at check in, but mentioned nothing about it to me. Called them and they said it should disappear from my card in a week or so...still affects my balance. I know other hotels generally check to see if there is a certain balance available, but I've never had one actually charge an amount...

Reviews.Title: “Easy location great bed”
Reviews.Author: wabeachbum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ramada for one night as we had an early train. The room was small but fine for our purposes, the bed was lovely and as soon as we saw it we wanted to throw ourselves on and sink in. The hotel does feel quite old and the hallways have a bit of a funny smell, but we didn't notice it in the room. The location is great, the area felt a little dodgy but is 2 blocks from gastown, or 2 blocks from granville st. We didn't get to try the breakfast due to our early departure. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent guest service, comfortable beds, beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: Taaadas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Ramada in Vancouver one week in January and it was amazing. I got a free upgrade to a king-size bed, although I booked just a queen-size bed. They just told me, that they notice that I am a little bit taller and it would be better for me to sleep in a king-size bed. Amazing! The bed was so big and the room was clean. The front desk agents were very friendly and helpful. I had to catch my flight quite early in the morning, so I woke up earlier, but then I noticed that I have still some time, so I spent some time in the beautiful lobby. Because everything was still closed, they just brought a fresh coffee from the restaurant of the hotel, even it was still closed! I had a really good time in Vancouver and I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. Special thanks to Jadwiga and Rajiv.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina M
Reviews.Content: Me and my Husband came from Russia to stay at this hotel, we were greeted by Bruno, the front desk agent. He asked us for our credit card for a deposit, but since we weren't aware that we would have to leave a deposit the card didn't go through. We wanted to pay them the deposit with cash, Bruno said that was against their policy, but that he would make an exception for us if we agreed on the money being refunded on our card. We accepted and gave him US dollars, but unfortunately their hotel conversion rates aren't very good. Bruno then asked us to wait a couple of minutes while he went out of the hotel to change the money for us in a local currency exchange store. When he came back he had saved us about $30.00. Bruno was also very helpful with booking tours for us and recommending local restaurants during the rest of our stay. Thanks Bruno :)

Reviews.Title: “5 star staff at amazing rates”
Reviews.Author: Lady-Seahawks
Reviews.Content: This place hit a home run on how to staff a hotel! It just blew me away how helpful and well informed they were. Took my elderly mother on a short trip up to Vancouver just to see if it lived up to all the hype. Which it did, just to let you know. I mostly give the credit to the two lovely managers I met, Rajiv and Michalea. They worked with their team to make sure everything we needed plus more was accommodated for. I travel often, and I cannot compare their service any better than comparing it to a 5 star hotel with personal one to one assistance. I thank them and just adored their humor and helpfulness. Cutest team I've met to date. Bless you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kj_318
Reviews.Content: Great staff at this hotel. Very courteous and friendly. The front desk manager Rajiv was very helpful in checking us in and gave us some great places to see around Vancouver while we were visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People, Good location”
Reviews.Author: colin m
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk where awesome and upgraded us for no charge. Amazing location right in downtown Vancouver close to the party scene.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very creaky floors”
Reviews.Author: Alice_Steve_B
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver in the morning after a 14 hour overnight flight from Sydney. We had booked the night before arrival so we could access our room before check-in time. When we got to reception, it looked like staff had lost our booking or cancelled it because we were a no-show the night before, although our travel agent did note that we would arrive the morning after. Check-in was very slow. Room was a cosy size with a decent-ensuite. It faced inwards and so had no noise from the traffic. But creaking floors from above was horrendous and they would creak badly at all hours of the day and night. Two receptionists were very helpful with food suggestions, directions, day tour bookings and bear spray tip. Also well located on Granville St where a lot of pubs, bars, eateries, shops, a cinema and night clubs could be found.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: vfrpic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and shows its age in how loud it can be. The floors creak with every step and the walls are thin as paper, but the staff (and especially Mihaela Birzan) were great. The updating done to the hotel is nice. The location is fantastic and close to Robson street, Canada Place, and the metro. Fantastic dining is only a few blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great value xmas week!”
Reviews.Author: Art D
Reviews.Content: Somewhat dated, but well maintained building and centrally located. Had booked a room for 2 adults with 4 children which is difficult to find. The room they originally gave us was not what we had reserved. We had to sleep in a small room for 5 during the first night, but luckily the manager on duty (Mihaela Birzan) was able to very graciously provide us an upgrade to a suite for the remainder nights. Please note that parking is not included in your nightly rate and that the rooms facing the main street can be noisy. We're overall pleased with the service, the knowledge and friendliness of the staff. Special gratitude goes to Mihaela for the service and help provided.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pablo R
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful hotel with great service and an awesome location, near everything youwnt to see in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Neysa D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently and were pleasantly surprised by the great value, location to the entertainment district, and very helpful staff. The manager Mihaela, made sure that our stay was a great experience. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: PhillyGuy88
Reviews.Content: Walkable to Stanley Park/Shopping area to the west and Chinatown to the east. An older building but well maintained. Not much of other amenities. Would stay again if all you need is a simple pleasant place to sleep at low cost.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat guest”
Reviews.Author: Joseph S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and would recommend it to anyone looking for good value, excellent staff and a great location. I will be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “great staff at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaJoMiZ
Reviews.Content: We were recently married in Vancouver, BC - and had the privilege of staying at this hotel. Special kudos to Derrick Robinson - who made sure that our event was amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel for anybody. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, would love to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Raffleman
Reviews.Content: Not much to say on this over than it was a great experience and certainly what you expect from a hotel of this level. The rooms were great, got a free upgrade to a king size bed at no charge and they had all the amenities I needed. Restaurant attached was wonderful for breakfast. Didn't try it for any other meals. Overall, wonderful and very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, good location, excellent manager”
Reviews.Author: JazzyYazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money, located in the entertainment district in downtown Vancouver. On arrival, the front manager, Nikki, was super vibrant, positive, smilry, helpful and energetic. This set the tone for my four days at the hotel. The rooms are reasonable and I had requested a quiet room (having read other reviews) and didnt have any noise issues. For the price, my room was to a good standard, containing two double beds. Others have commented about safety. I do not think this was a concern at all. The area is bustling with lots of bars and clubs nearby (some good, some rubbish!) but the issue of homeless people is a general issue in Vancouver. It is something you get used to, and does not present a threat, but clearly not well managed by the government. On the whole, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and all that you really need”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights and although the rooms are slightly smaller than what I am used to, the bedding was extremely comfortable, it had a spacious bathroom with a good shower, and the free wifi worked really well for the entire time. No need to log in or use any password as you just click on the hotels wifi and it loads. This is an older hotel which has been refurbished right in the heart of all the buzz and life of central Vancouver. An easy walk to anything, with a good supermarket (Safeway) not far away on Davie Street. The room also had a flat screen 32 inch tv with a good selection of channels. The hotel is very handy to public transport and a bus stop right outside the hotel. We had a rental car for part of the stay with onsite parking available at $15 per night. The parking metres in the area run from 9am until 10pm and only cost $2 per hour with plenty of free parking spaces after 7.00pm. For the price paid, I would very much recommend this hotel for people who would rather spend their money on enjoying their holiday, rather than on costly hotel rooms which are only required as a base to sleep. I found the staff very friendly and helpful, and the cleaning was to a very good standard.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Tabbers
Reviews.Content: We booked this weekday one night October stay through a "discount" site and once I knew the property name, I contacted them directly to request a room with a Queen (or larger) sized bed and to verify check in/check out times. After several e-mail requests, I finally received a reply; I was told that since I booked through a discount site, they couldn't guarantee anything since I was assigned "a random room type <they> have remaining in their inventory." Our room had double beds, was very cramped and dingy, and faced the street. We were able to pin the drapes closed and shut the bathroom door to keep out the bright lights at night; however, there was nothing we could do to eliminate the street noise (busses, cars, shouting people) and I wasn't able to sleep at all. I wasn't about to ask for a different room considering what I was previously told via e-mail. I concur with other reviewers comments about the odor - it smelled like Lysol in the hallways. The vacuuming job in our room was also sub-par and I found something that resembled a chocolate covered raisin or some other type of candy next to our trash can - I didn't get close enough to make a positive identification. Parking is also initially a challenge as they have a very small lot right next to the hotel; once you check in your car is valeted off site. Fortunately, we walked to our venue but it would have been a hassle not to have immediate access to our vehicle if needed. But they do state that 24 hour access is available - all you have to do is call the front desk and they retrieve your car within 10 minutes. The front desk staff was pleasant and friendly, which is the most positive thing I can say about our stay. Next time we go up to BC I will spend the money and book directly with a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “On holiday over 2 60s”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid V
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our holiday in Canada. The staff were friendly, service very good too, and the hotel although old, was very clean and had been refurbished. Beds were very comfy. It is in a good position not too far from the main shopping centre, with many eateries in the surrounding streets. A 24 hour 711 store was a short walk away. There is a lot of tourist information in the lobby .We paid approx $CAD29 for the taxi ride to the airport. We got a better rate rebooking a return visit at the hotel than online. We would stay there again and recommend it to any-one. Thanks Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Not really "suited" for everyone”
Reviews.Author: TravelB1tch25
Reviews.Content: We booked the Family studio suite for 6 people. Suites – small, outdated. No fridge and microwave as advertised on their website. Bathroom - cramped, awkward shower, no bathtub. Parking – $20/night valet only. No access to car until checkout because car is parked off site. *If hotel is fully booked, they will not take your car for valet because they have limited valet space. Prepare to look for overnight parking yourself. Location – busy, central nightlife district. *Something to consider, there is a busy nightclub directly located on the main floor. Value – So-so. There’s a lot more better and equipped hotels around downtown that is cheaper and has better value. *Watch out for extra charges on your bill upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location for the price”
Reviews.Author: weniale
Reviews.Content: i was coming to vancouver from vancouver island to attend a canucks game and do some shopping. i chose this hotel not really knowing the area that well but it ended up being perfect for me. just a minutes walk away, there was a bus that went directly to the arena. everything i could have possibly needed was in a 15 minute walking radius. it really was the best place i could've chosen as it forced me to explore the area and figure out where things were. the room i had was a queen sized bed, on the 2nd floor and it faced the light well. while the room was small, it worked well for me. not sure how it would be with 2 people but i was just fine. im a light sleeper to begin with so the noise that i did hear wasn't anything worth complaining about. i did though stay tuesday to friday so a weekend may be a different story. i only have 2 minor complaints: 1. there was a strong smelling cleaner used in the main hallways and the elevators. very overpowering. 2. no fan in the bathroom. while there is a small window in the bathroom, it doesn't really offer privacy to have that open as anyone in the rooms across can look in and see you once you leave the shower. i left the door in the bathroom open to see if that would help but a fan would still have been helpful. overall, i definitely recommend this place if you're looking for something cheap (but not too cheap) and in a good location. i will be returning for sure on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Savannah020
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Inn is a very good hotel in downtown Vancouver. It is located near the commercial centre and is on walking distance from Canada place and the harbour. There are more hotels in this part of the city. What makes this hotel stand out is the quality of the rooms and the level of service from employees and staff. Especially at the price you pay. You get what you pay for. I was a single woman, for the first time travelling on her own. They took time to make feel comfortable and they even gave me an opportunity to rebook a non-refundable booking. And they agreed to do that while they were actually overbooked. Now that is service!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, amazing value for money, brilliant friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: nussiUK
Reviews.Content: So if you want to stay in an hotel where the whole of the downtown area is within walking distance and transit transport links are fantastic for those venturing further afield, where the staff are friendly and go the extra mile to be helpful, where the rooms are spotlessly clean and the beds are extremely comfortable, where the entertainment district is within 5 minutes walk, where the 'pub' next door serves good food and is perfectly welcoming, then the Ramada on Granville Street is perfect. If you want value for money right in the centre of town then this is the hotel for you. This was my second stay at the Ramada Granville Street and the quality of service, cleanliness and comfort were as high if not better than my first visit here in 2010. The rooms are perfect for those intent on making the most of the city and have every amenity that a traveller can expect - including an extremely comfortable bed, large flat screen tv, large bathrooms with a great shower , plenty of drawer and wardrobe space, a free daily newspaper, friendly and helpful housekeeping staff. For those travelling without laptops or mobile access to the internet there is a complimentary computer station for guests use - great for occasionally checking into emails and on-line check in to homeward flight. I'll be staying again on my next trip to Vancouver and I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants a comfortable, value for money, unpretentious, place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Diane F
Reviews.Content: Had misfortune to stay in this " hotel " at the begining and end of my holiday. Althoughit did not spoil my overall trip it had the capacity to do so. The " hotel " is situated in what I would describe as the red light district and had an abundance of sex shops and homeless in the area. "Not a safe area " was how a local cab driver called it. The hotel itself was shabby and had an overpowering smell of disinfectant, ( what were they trying to diguise ). The carpets appeared unclean and our room while smelly,dank and souless had a fantastic view of three walls,a fire escape and an abundance of fird feathers with droppings to match. Would I stay here again ? .....................Only if I was homeless

Reviews.Title: “Thumping bass from night club next door until 3 AM”
Reviews.Author: roobieroo
Reviews.Content: One thing I really wish I had known prior to booking this hotel was that there is a night club right next door that pumps out non stop thumping bass until 3 AM. I wasn't even on the first floor and the I could feel and hear the booming drum beats and bass loud and clear. If you can sleep with a screaming baby next to your head then this probably won't be an issue but otherwise I would try and find other accommodations. If you have to stay here, bring earplugs and take some sleeping pills. If you're planning on going clubbing and will not be going to bed until after 3 AM anyway then this might also be a good place for you. The club wasn't open Sunday night and it was a much better experience. That said, the fact that it's a bit of a gamble as to whether or not you're going to be able to get to sleep before 3 AM just isn't worth it. If you plan to party until after 3 in the morning or if you can sleep through pretty much anything it would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place Ive ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: eljay1954
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune to stay in this hotel for 2 separate nights at the start and end of a package tour. It was so awful on the first night that the thought of returning marred the whole holiday. Whilst the location maybe fairly central, the area immediately adjacent to the hotel was mostly occupied by seedy clubs and sex shops. Granville St was populated mostly by drug addicts, alcoholics and the homeless. As 2 middle aged female travellers, we were accosted numerous times by these unfortunates and were so concerned for our personal safety we felt obliged to hail a taxi for the very short distance back to the hotel. I speak as a resident of a big city with a poor reputation for crime but I have never been so scared to be on the street. The hotel itself stank. When we first checked in the corridors and our room smelt so strongly of floral disinfectant we thought the place had just been fumigated. We immediately left the hotel and returned only at bedtime. Sadly the floral smell had vanished and the only comparison I can make to the smell that remained was of raw sewage. The whole area of the hotel had this smell so there was little point in changing rooms. When we asked the front desk what the smell was we were told it was probaly paint as they were renovating!!! Next morning we waited patiently for the hotel restaurant (Morriseys?) to open for breakfast. We wished we hadn't. After walking into the restaurant and seeing what a dump it was, we walked straight out. On our second stay we were upgraded to a suite because of our complaint. The corridor to the room had that same horrible smell but fortunately most of the room was smell free. I thought the bed hadn't been changed after the previous occupants but the front desk assured me that wasn't the case but they don't iron their sheets. I have never stayed in a hotel that does not iron sheets. Enough said? This hotel really clouded my judgement of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A work trip made all the sweeter”
Reviews.Author: George W
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Vancouver, the happenchance choice of the Ramada Inn and Suites was spectacular. In the heart of downtown, every convenience was within an arms reach. The staff was superb in their service, especially in the advice for places to eat or see within the downtown core. Would recommend it whole heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and surprisingly comfy room”
Reviews.Author: aa87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night after 3 nights at the Sutton Place and were pleasantly surprised by how comfortable the bed was! The room was small and its a no frills hotel but the location is great, the room and bathroom were very clean and there was free wi-fi. There is a jacuzzi in the bathtub but we did not have the opportunity to use it! It is surrounded by shops and restaurants and is a stone's throne away from Yaletown. We will definitely stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the people”
Reviews.Author: Soldado R
Reviews.Content: A hotel is just a place you stay for a short period of time. I will always remember this hotel because of the people that work here. True professionals like Micaela made me want to come back sooner. I recommend this hotel to all of my friends from Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PS_Arnold
Reviews.Content: There were limited rooms when we checked in so were given a suite rather than a regular room which was a bonus having the extra space. Was a little worried about noise reading the other posts, but no problem for us - we seemed to have a room overlooking a central lightwell, not a great view but quiet. Staff, front desk and cleaning very friendly. Room very clean. Location was ideal for walking to all parts of the town including the little ferry to Granville island, although a little less salubrious later at night. Only issue I had was the parking, expensive valet service where they appear to put the car in the pay and display round the corner at half the price and even when I asked for the car to be brought round it was never ready and had to ask again when I got to reception.

Reviews.Title: “Just barely ok”
Reviews.Author: nomoreknothead
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the downtown entertainment district.....Bad choice on my part! We booked this hotel for a one night ( Thank the Lord) Post-Cruise. We were greeted by the front desk clerk, if you can call it a greeting. She simply asked if we were checking-in? We were very early considering that we got off the ship at 8:30am, They did not have our room ready but told us they could upgrade us to a suite that was ready! We said that would be fine. Sure glad we did because if the room we got was a suite I would sure have hated to stay in a regular room. The room was ok but that is about it. It was two small rooms plus a bathroom. 1st room had a love seat, desk & tv, 2nd room had two full size beds. The beds were comfortable but the street noise was not good for sleep. We could hear every car, bus , firetruck, or ambulance that was on the street. People were yelling all night, it being a Friday night in the entertainment district!! Homeless folks & beggers were everywhere. We ate across the street and then stayed locked in our tiny room. The floors squeaked with every footstep! First look everything appears to be clean, but don't look to close. Light fixture over the sink had dust build up from maybe a month or longer. There was hair in the coffee pot. I would not stay here again! Plain & Simple....Too many hotels choices.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: shr74
Reviews.Content: It is perhaps not the best part of Granville but it is so close to so many great restaurants and bars that for $100/night it is a pretty sweet deal. The parking will cost you $15+tax/day which is a bit annoying. But being so central you are better off w/o the car. We had a 2-bed room which was pretty small but had it all and pretty clean. The wireless was kinda slow but worked fine for browsing. The view from the room on the back yard is anything but breathtaking but it saved us from the traffic on Granville. You are litterally a couple of blocks from Yaletown and Hamilton street. The public bus stop is in front of the entrance with connections to pretty much all key areas in Vancouver. Overall a good experience but not worth more than $120/night.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travel B
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work, in the States, across Canada, and I've seen a lot of hotels. I'm also from Toronto, so I am used to the environment that you are surrounded by staying in this hotel. Pan-handling and the downtown crowd didn't bother me. However, a lot of the service was really disappointing. My first night, jet lagged from a long flight, I just wanted to crawl into bed and sleep. When I pulled the duvet back, the sheets were severely wrinkled and had obvioulsy not been changed from the previous guest. I asked them to be changed, and returned the next day to see that they were still on the bed. In fact, for my entire stay (5 nights). If I hadn't prepaid for the entire week, I would have left. The "Valet " parking, not sure how you would define that. It basically meant give us the keys to your car so we can play musical cars. There is no parking, or bringing your car to the front. It wound up costing me $200 damage to the rental, which I only noticed when I was at the airport, and on my way to catch a flight. That's money that could have been better spent, on top of the valet cost!!! But the best part was when I knelt by my suitcase as I was trying to pack. The overwhelming smell emitted from the carpet. I had to hold my wrist to my nose to prevent from gagging. Like I said, I've been in a lot of hotels, big cities and small. The sad thing is I turned down another hotel in the area because I said "It's a Ramada". So disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quite above expectations”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: Was in Vancouver for business and booked the Ramada because the hotel my company uses was booked. I was pleasantly impressed with the quality of service received. The staff was very professional, helpful and really nice. The rooms are ok, the area can be noisy - patriculary on weekends - but this is downtown Vancouver. Will most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dorsa made my trip an exciting memory”
Reviews.Author: Dafna S
Reviews.Content: I visited at the hotel for about a week, in April, coming for a conference in Simon Fraser University. I wish to thank Dorsa, although along time passed since then, for her professional advices and warm personality. Dorsa was such a hug help! She advice me where to visit, help finding the fastest way (she called train and bus stations). She helped kindly always with a smile with any question and need in the hotel/ I want to thank her and you for these lovely trip I had. Dr. Dafna Sagiv-Reiss, room 4128, Israel

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Joanna W
Reviews.Content: Visiting vancouver from the UK. Had a great time, staff was great, location was close tio everything. Wish I can come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: wjprime
Reviews.Content: Room was small and not overly attractive (although bathroom was nice, recently renovated) but for US$120/day you couldn't ask for more when other hotels were going for $175-250. We decided to save on room to then spend on attractions. The Ramada is in an easily accessible location with many restaurants, bars and attractions in easy reach. Free wifi is a plus. Front desk staff answer all tourist questions with friendliness and patience and help u plan out your itineraries and give helpful suggestions. My advice is to pay abut more for the king size bed in the hopes room will be somewhat bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Jacobo B
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the hotel is in a great location... only minutes to fun on Davie St., Granville St, or Yaletown. Buses at the door. The rooms are small yet comfortable. Good value overall!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Roy K
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, it was on a long weekend. The Price was high, and there was only 1 room left. The concierge, Mihaela Birzan, figured out how to lower the price by over 20% ( we stayed for a week), gave us one of the best suites in the hotel, arranged us a free entrance to the club nearby (which was quite luxurious) and attended all our needs in a very professional and pleasant manner. The hotel is located on a very central street, close to many clubs and bars. The room was large, clean, full equipped and comfortable. It was a great stay! A lot of it due the Mihaela's professionalism and care. Thank you :)

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Erika46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to many tourist attractions, which you can reach easily by foot. If you don't know your way around, the receptionists always offer their help and give you directions or print them out for you. Questions like how the phone works were answered very friendly and immediately, as well as any other concerns we had. Especially the front desk agent Mihaela was very helpful and even gave us good insider advice, for example where the food was really good or which attractions we couldn't miss. Everything she recommended was great, and we would have missed some things for sure if she hadn't told us about them, for example the Celebration of Lights. The other receptionists were also very friendly and happy to help you. This was an outstanding holiday for sure and we will definetely stay at the Ramada again if we happen to be in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “" Amazing Staff and we'll definitely be back "”
Reviews.Author: bluzac2010
Reviews.Content: It was actually my second time in this hotel.. The 1st one was back in February..I suggested to my friends that we stay in Ramada because of my amazing experience with the hotel back then. This time, me and my friends stayed with the hotel for 4 amazing nights. Due to holiday and pride the hotel was really packed. There has been a bit of miscommunication with the room but we are very thankful to Mihaela, one of the lovely frontdesks, who took an extra mile to ensure that our stay will be wonderful and hassle free.. We'll definitely going to be back because of her.. Thanks again guysss..! see you next time.! : )

Reviews.Title: “Great team at work in a cute and small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Breakthru420
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a little small but the bed is comfortable. The best thing about this hotel is the team working there and they are very helpful with everything. Dorsa, Nicky and all of them (except for Michaela...) are maybe the most helpful and nicest hotel staff that I ever came across which just makes the stay all that much better!

Reviews.Title: “Book last minute, very happy.”
Reviews.Author: DarrenBailes
Reviews.Content: As the title says, we booked last minute and got a great deal. The hotel is in a good location, near to a subway tha you can ride from the airport. The down point would be that there is many homeless within the area, however we found the homeless numbers shocking in Vancouver as a whole. The room we got was massive, the bathroom was clean and with a great shower. Good sized TV etc. One problem was our room was next to the lift shaft, which was quite loud, but if you book last minute, you cant complain too much. Found the staff to be fine, no compliants. On reflection, we would book closer to the city centre in advance, and pay a lot more probably. We would still recommend however as it served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: keith_8030
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant place to stay, very courteous staff. Made everything comfortable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!! Wonderful staff and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: zCalgarian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ramada in granville in June on my vacation and I had a wonderful time. The staff were exceptional and the location was great. I was happy that they were located downtown. I was able to get around perfectly and the staff gave me great service. When I needed directions or help with what tour to take. Their advice was spot on. Cant want to visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: BWPLUSAustrianChalet
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel and had nothing but exceptional service, the Front Desk staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. They were also very accommodating for our early arrival on the day of check in. The room was very clean and decor was very nice. We had all the amenities we would have hoped for including WIFI. Our room had a great sitting room, very comfy beds and air conditioning which was ideal! The location was great for restaurants, night entertainment as well as shopping and close to Rogers Arena for the concerts we were in town for. Overall it was exactly what we were looking for in a hotel in Vancouver and was very affordable compared to other hotels we had looked at. We would 100% stay again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “I was Treated like a 2nd class citizen.”
Reviews.Author: alanalgipan
Reviews.Content: As we arrived early like 10am. and my booking had been cancelled due to a credit card issue which I had no control over or no prior knowledge. we were treated like 2nd class citizens as we tried to pay with CASH. and even a 250 dollar deposit was frowned on as we tried to pay with CASH. then we had to wait until 4pm for a room. at 150+ dollar per night. if the monies had been extracted from my card and we were not happy with this hotel, we would have lost our money as other guests had to endure. and as for the area of this hotel......it has to be the worst down town area I have ever seen due to the amount of Vagrants and drug related people, all outside this hotel asking for a cigarette or cash, the room was actually ok. but staff and cleanliness was dreadfull. MCFC

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Timom_v
Reviews.Content: My four person family and my parents were at Vancouver 16.-26.6.2011. As we arrived we first got room upgrade (with kitchenette) to our room. It was very good for children (thanks Mihaela!). My moms tooth broke down and the reception helped us to get the appointment to the dentist right away (thanks Nikki!). The location of the hotel was great because of short distances to the skytrain stations, bus stops, restaurants, shops and so on. Also downtown center and the Waterfront is fairly nearby. It takes only 10-15 minutes to walk there. In the end of our holiday we noticed that in the downtown area the taxis don't take more than four persons aboard (despite the size of a taxi). So we left to the airport by limousine and it was cheaper than two taxi's together (thanks Mihaela for arrangements!) All the staff and espesially the girls in the reception were very helpfull to us. Thank you all !!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but loud”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirl98
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying for 5 nights at the Ramada. I was in town for business and wanted something central. The check-in and service was very friendly and the room was clean and comfy. The loudness of the floor was insane though. My room faced in so I didn't even get street noise. It was people coming in at all hours, having loud and drunk conversations in the hall and it was almost impossible to get a decent sleep. Bring good earplugs if you want a chance at a good sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: kandykrista
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. If you enjoy walking around downtown Vancouver during the day and partying in the evening, you'll love this place. It is close to all the great restaurants, bars and clubs. The room we stayed in was a little small but the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. We really enjoyed the pub downstairs of the hotel. The best thing about this hotel is the customer service. I booked my reservation for the hotel at an online hotel site. I accidently booked the wrong date of my stay, when I tried to change the date of my reservation, they would not change it and said that I would lose my money. I called the hotel directly and talked with Nicky Best. She helped me and changed the reservation for me directly at the hotel. She was a pleasure to talk with on the phone and very helpful. I know she didn't have to change anything or help me out since I was the one who paid for the room with the wrong date. I will definitely come back and stay here when I come back to Vancouver. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and family who want to hang out in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Over valued.”
Reviews.Author: SFin1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I didn't want to compromise my stay by paying a bit extra. I wanted the standard of quality that I have seen with Ramada's in the past. this hotel did not live up to that standard. There was nothing specifically wrong with the room. There was a hair in the bed, but what are you going to do. The main issue I had was that the room was small, and the amenities were limited. My room didn't even have a window you could open. In the summer that kind of sucks, since I didn't want to sleep with their industrial sized air conditioning unit on. No mini-fridge, limited wifi, and a very, very small room. There wasn't any room to do anything other than lay on the bed. They are located right in the heart of Granville, which is a great location. The drawbacks were the nightlife, but i knew that going in. I saw that they had security camera's that were on the parking lot, but someones car still got broken into the night I was there. At the end of the day, they are charging what they think a Ramada inn room should go for, but it is not at all worth it. Even as cheap as it is, the other hotels in the area offered much more for hardly any price increase.

Reviews.Title: “Let the party begin”
Reviews.Author: americaneagle1989
Reviews.Content: Going out partying? Why waste money on cabs and buses if you can just stay on Granville right in the heart of if all? Loved my stay here. Loved Vancouver. Loved the staff. Just wanted to let them know I appreciated everything they have done for us.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: dmc001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ramada for a day in June. The hotel is absolutely in the center, close to everything , with proximity to every venue the city has to offer . I did not have to use my car because walking the streets was such a delight. I want to extend my thanks to an exceptional staff. They made this establishment feel like a five star venue. I especially want to thank Mihaela for her courtesy , kindness and valuable information during my stay. She made us feel at home. Some experiences in this world make you feel happy to be alive!!!!. This was one of them....

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back on my next trip!!”
Reviews.Author: emily888Seattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ramada with my boyfriend and had an amazing time! The staff were really helpful and nice; they helped us find restaurants and guided us around town. We got a great deal online and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel staff were great. the rest of the hotel? not so much”
Reviews.Author: forkontheroad
Reviews.Content: They seemed adamant on writing a review on Trip Advisor with a computer they provided a few feet away to tell the rest of the world how helpful/pleasant our experience was at Ramada. But this was just after 3minutes into our stay as we received our keys for the first time! That seemed a little odd. So we head up the elevator to our rooms and the second the elevator opens, it reeks of mold or damp towels. Once we actually get inside, we see stains in the carpet, notice the bathroom door locks are the kind where you push the knob in and turn to lock, and the none of the noise from the surrounding clubs are muffled. By day two, we realized the shower spews h20 with particles of rust and the water itself has this tea color to it. This is definitely for those on a budget(and I paid about 100/night for it!...Vancouver hotels in general are pricey) and for a maximum stay of 2nights. It's better than a hostel and definitely not a 3-star hotel or above.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Ramada for making me feel like home!!!”
Reviews.Author: blueeyes02_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ramada in June and i had an amanzing stay. The locations is great, right in the heart of downtown, the room was very clean and the beds very comfy. The staff and management was unique. I've never met such friendly people behind the desk, they were very friendly giving me directions and restaurant suggestions. The free wifi was a big plus. The romanian manager was very nice and made us feel like home. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and family and i will be back every time i have a chance. Thank you guys, keep up the good work and keep on having fun. I LOVE RAMADA GRANVILLE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sold our fully pre-paid room to someone else, gave no compensation, management were not apologetic”
Reviews.Author: faceInTheCrowd
Reviews.Content: This hotel sold our fully pre-paid room to someone else, and we had to stay miles away from downtown for our first night. That's bad enough, but the way we were dealt with by the management was an absolute disgrace. The manager we spoke to didn't apologise, refused to offer a cent of compensation, and threatened to kick us out on the street. The full details of what happened are as follows: BACKGROUND Myself, my brother, and my father were in Vancouver for 3 nights at the end of May as part of a 2-and-a-half week city-hopping holiday following a family wedding in Las Vegas. We chose the Ramada because of its downtown location, and because it had rooms with 2 beds plus a sofa bed, meaning that all 3 of us could sleep in the same room, but in separate beds. Our experience in this hotel was the single bad experience we had over the course of what was otherwise an extremely enjoyable holiday. WHAT WENT WRONG Our room was booked and FULLY PRE-PAID several weeks before our stay. However, because we knew we were going to be arriving late (after midnight), I phoned ahead from Vegas early in the afternoon of the day we were due to check-in to let the hotel know our expected time of arrival. I was assured that it was not a problem; they confirmed that they had our reservation, that it was all paid for and that our room would be kept for us no matter what time we arrived. However when we arrived (about 1am), the desk staff spent some time looking at their computer and paper records, and eventually informed us that there had been a mistake, and that our room had been sold to someone else. What's more, they had no more rooms available for the first night of our stay (but they had a room for us for the second and third nights). Clearly, to sell a fully pre-paid room to someone else is a pretty huge mistake to make. HOW RAMADA DEALT WITH IT ON THE NIGHT While we waited a member of staff phoned around other downtown hotels, but was unable to find us a room in the area (it was a saturday night, and everywhere seemed to be full). They therefore had to book us into another Ramada (at Kingsway), a 20-25 minute cab ride away from the downtown area. Between arriving at the first Ramada and checking in at the second, a period of more than an hour had elapsed- an hour of lost sleep and frustration. We had to pay up front for the night at Ramada Kingsway (meaning at this point we had paid for the saturday night twice over), and for the cab fare. The Ramada Kingsway was not a particularly nice hotel, and the room we were given had 2 beds but no sofa bed. As I mentioned above, one of the reasons we booked the room in Ramada Granville was that it could sleep the three of us in separate beds. As such, the sleeping arrangements at Ramada Kingsway were not ideal. However, it was the best that could be done given the earlier mistake, and so we settled down to sleep. HOW RAMADA DEALT WITH IT THE NEXT DAY After getting to bed so late on Saturday night, we awoke late on the Sunday morning, with the hassle of moving our luggage back to Ramada Granville St and checking in still ahead of us (eating in to our limited time in Vancouver). We paid for a taxi back to the Ramada Granville St and went to check in. At the check-in desk a female member of the management team approached us, saying that she had heard about us. At this point we fully expected her to be apologetic, to offer us compensation for the inconvenience, and to go out her way to make the remainder of our stay a happy one. We couldn't have been more wrong. Her demeanour absolutely stunned us. Instead of being apologetic, her manner was confrontational and nothing that she said constituted an apology. She kept saying things like "mistakes happen, but it's in the past, move on". We did get reimbursed for the taxi fares and for the first night at Ramada Granville St, meaning that we had no longer paid for the saturday night twice over. However, no offer of compensation was forthcoming, and when I raised the issue her response was breathtaking. It was along the lines of "What's the point, how's that going to help you? What's happened is in the past, and me giving you money isn't going to help with that". Wow, so this hotel clearly thinks that if they make a monumental mistake and inconvenience their customers they don't need to apologise or provide recompense. At this point I was struggling to believe what I was hearing, but it was about to get worse. The next thing she did was essentially to threaten to kick us out onto the streets! She said that as we were clearly unhappy, she wasn't sure she wanted us staying in the hotel, and she would rather we stayed somewhere else. Again, we were utterly stunned. We felt backed into a corner, as we really didn't want to have to waste more time finding another hotel, and we knew it would be difficult to find somewhere to suit our sleeping arrangements. As such, we reluctantly backed down, and left the matter at that. We checked in, and over the next two days spent as little time in the hotel as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kj_318
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite frankly one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at due in part to the staff. I've stayed here before and they were very courteous, caring, and made sure we were comfortable when we visited. They even remembered me from my past visit. I've recommended them to my friends in the past and they all say the same thing about the staff. My friends and myself will continue to do business with them, thanks Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,Great room,Great price”
Reviews.Author: Mattsj
Reviews.Content: Have been there on business and pleasure and its hard to find fault on anything about the hotel..its a value priced hotel so you are not getting swimming pools and a work out room,but if your into sightseeing and using your room to sleep and rest its great! Rooms are clean,staff helpful and friendly..and the location is amazing..you are minutes away from the entertainment district..minutes away from the subway and minutes away from shopping..and if you don't want to go anywhere ..there is a hip modern Irish pub right next door,or u can walk a few blocks and your at Bin 941 which is a top reviewed restaurant. You're right downtown so it can be lively but so ask the staff to recommend a quiet room if your sensitive to street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Rooms in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TyB77
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently spent 2 nights at the Ramada Inn and suites on Granville Street and both found no faults what-so-ever. Our room was very quiet at night, rare for downtown Vancouver, and comfortable. The staff was fantastic. Very courteous and extremely helpful. The location was un-beatable. Minutes walk from all the excitement and shopping Granville Street, and the whole downtown core for that matter, has to offer. If you love to visit Vancouver as much as I do, you can't go wrong with a stay at The Ramada Inn and Suites, Granville.

Reviews.Title: “Go Canucks”
Reviews.Author: Nuckers
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this Ramada to catch some of the Stanley Cup hype. We had some trouble at check in but the management was extremely accomodating and even bought us breakfast! This hotel is in a great location. Definitely worth a stay if you want to be in a safe area right downtown. They were so accomodating. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Decent amenities. Loud.”
Reviews.Author: Wilburys66
Reviews.Content: There are a large number of restaurants and bars within walking distance. The staff is friendly and efficient. Amenities are standard. You do have to walk outside and around the block to access the gym. Internet is good. There is a club near the hotel, so there is a constant bass booming until about 2am. Some rooms are more suseptible than others, so it would pay to request a room facing the alley. I thought it was a bit overpriced for its class, but we were there on a peak night and the hotel was booked full, so maybe that's just my perception. I'm not against staying there again, but I will likely explore other options on my next visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “good spot if your going out on the town”
Reviews.Author: Distant_Scott
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here for a one night stop over on a Saturday night. We wanted to get to sleep early as we had a large day planned ahead. Front office staff were friendly and welcoming and warned us the hotel does get noise due to the club inside the hotel. Our first room was right next to the elevator on the quiet side of the hotel, unfortunatky the floorboard for the room above sounded like they were going to break and the noise from people going in and out of the elevator made us ask for a new room. The front desk staff mentioned they only had a room on the noise side with the club but it was away from the elevator but were more then willing to accomodate us. If your not there to visit the clubs or don't like big bass then I don't suggest staying here on the weekends. We were OK once we got our earplugs in. Great spot if you are going clubbing or want to explore granville at night. Comfortable rooms and helpful front office staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, Will recommend to my family, friends, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Onyang60
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and nice & helpful personnel especially those in the front desk. (Raj and Gill)

Reviews.Title: “HISTORY with an UP BEAT atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: chaplinturner
Reviews.Content: the Ramada is a heritage building. it has been around for 100 yrs. the building is in excellent condition for being a old timer....the rooms are cozy with exceptionally large bathrooms. i was amazed by the staff. they were very friendly, great big smiles all the time,they made you feel welcomed, like you were one of the family visiting at their home. the location is great. you are in walking distance of everything, such as, shopping, pubs, live entertainment, great dining, Granville island and much more. this place has tons of charm. the energy and life that the staff bring to this building is just one of the many fantastic characteristics you will come to love.

Reviews.Title: “the best ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GeronimoGDL
Reviews.Content: my family and I stayed at Ramada , we were not a common guest, we were there for the cruiceship to Alaska, we were at least 15 people, the staff is amazing, helpfull and the location is just the best even with the club next door! We had a blast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Employees”
Reviews.Author: BCalla01
Reviews.Content: We had a very good vacation. This hotel was among very good restaurants and night life. The people working at the front desk were very accommodating and helpful in planning our outings. Much like any busy downtown city but smaller. The rooms were a little small but very clean and comfortable. Public transit outside the front make getting around to attractions very easy. Hockey playoffs make spirit in the city amazing and hotel people helped us feel at home with their team. Very amazing lounge at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There was a "creature"-”
Reviews.Author: sarahdevlin
Reviews.Content: Checked in Friday afternoon/early evening with friends for a weekend in Vancouver. We proceeded to leave the hotel to walk around downtown and to get food/drinks somewhere. Upon return to the room, around 10 pm... we all sit down to hang out/get ready for the evening and as I am sitting on the bed, SOMETHING runs directly into my foot and then proceeds to scurry under the bed. I instantly jump up onto the bed and scream. My friends think I am crazy and that there was nothing actually there- A couple of minutes later the same SOMETHING runs back out from under the bed to under the couch. At this point, everyone sees it and screams. So we attempt to tackle the situation ourselves and tried to catch the thing. This didn't work because we could never find it again- my guess is it was living in the couch. I proceeded down to the front desk to inform them of the situation. They could not move us that night because there were no other rooms available like the one we were in, so we settled for a partially comped room price and free entrance to the bar next door. The next day, we had to pack up and move rooms. That next night, upon returning to the hotel around 2 am, I get in the elevator with another unhappy couple from floor 5 who say they have a mouse or something of the sorts in their room. (we were in floor 1 for reference) I told them GOOD LUCK. Needless to say, the Ramada has an issue with mice or cockroaches, or a 'cockamouse' as my friends nicknamed the mysterious black something that ran around our room. For the price of the rooms a night, there should not be any creatures running around sharing the room-

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and I was very happy with my choice despite the odd negative review on here. I arrived via Seattle on Amtrak so picked up my car and came by to check in quite early. That was no problem and I was soon in my second level room which was quite spacious and included a large flatscreen tv.
