There was a like a hallway between the main bedroom to the bathroom which I used to spread my luggage out. The staff was friendly and ever helpful especially the valet who was forever moving cars around as the carpark does get pretty full. I opted for self parking which cost $15 + taxes which is a little rough but it is in the middle of downtown. Yes, the elevator is very slow but since I was on the second floor, I only used the elevator once on check-in and used the stairs throughout my stay there. I did stay mid-week so unsure about the infamous club noise that people have written about here but I had no problems with noise during the nights. The location is perfect for nightlife and dining and I walked to most of Vancouver's attractions from here - Canada Place, Robson St, Gastown, Chinatown, Granville Island etc

Reviews.Title: “served with gratitude”
Reviews.Author: jitsy
Reviews.Content: only required a 1 night stay with friends for a night of clubbing next door at gingers. got to the hotel quite late and was given fast and efficient service by lady called Dorsa at reception. after getting ready she took us down to the club herself and got us entry into the VIP queue and after we didnt encounter 1 problem....

Reviews.Title: “Great location....close to Yaletown and Granville Island”
Reviews.Author: TTExcellentAdventure
Reviews.Content: Not fancy, but good value if you are here for a few days. We were seeing the sights prior to departing on a cruise to Alaska and it was fine. Staff is very friendly and accomodating especially Mihaela on the front desk. Downsides: lumpy pillows (my poor neck....!!!); need towel racks in the bathrooms (it's a concept); hallways are tired (it's an older building); elevators are a nightmare and need to be updated...... hope you like stairs...!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: bkolp21
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. I am a seasoned traveller; in the last 6 months I have spent 33 nights in hotels in 8 different countries around the world and this hotel was the absolute worst. They are right next to a night club, which they do not tell you on the website nor when you check in. The music starts at 10:30pm and ends at 3am. I was on the 5th floor and not only did the music wake me up but the bed was actually vibrating from the bass. When I called the front desk the only thing they offered was ear plugs. I have never had such a bad experience, it was worse than sleeping in at a youth hostel in college. When one of only two elevators was out not working I could deal with that, I could put up with the small rooms, I could handle the fact that my ironing board was broken, but all of that on top of the VERY loud club keeping me up all night was just too much. Unprofessional, inconsiderate, and hands down one of the worst hotels in the world. You're better off sleeping in your car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but would try somewhere different next time”
Reviews.Author: bopper12
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed in the ramada inn for a week at the end of april. this is nice hotel in great location. our hotel room was ok, it was small enough with nice bathroom. the pillows were terrible for trying to sleep on and the noise from outside didnt help.. Granville street is the main night club/pubs in downtown and it does get noisey our hotel room was on the 6th floor facing the street so it was very noisy at the weekend and when the Canucks won the hockey :) We had a few wee problems i.e key card for room broke while we were there and needed to get management to let us into our rooms. this was only for 1 night and management were very helpfull and professional.. Over all i would recommend this to hotel to a young couple i.e 18-30 who would be out and about enjoying the night life. its very cheap hotel with very helpful staff who are there to help.. there is just a wide range of hotels in this location thats my reason for not going back

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Travelling48
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. They have just remodeled the lobby and it looks great. Very sophisticated. Mihaela was there to greet me and gave me a very comfortable room. Its clean, quiet, the duvet is like rolling in feathers. It's close to all the highlights and things to do in Vancouver. Really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: clmak
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to be in Vancouver in March for business meetings and stayed at the Ramada Downtown. I loved the hotel - the location is ideal, you can walk to great dining, shopping and nightlife entertainment spots. Really close to the seawall as well. The rooms were newly renovated and spotless! And lastly the staff was fantastic - very friendly and attentive which was nice to see at such a busy location. I would highly recommend the Ramada to friends and colleagues traveling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE MIHAELA”
Reviews.Author: powerpigeon
Reviews.Content: Mihaela the front desk agent should be promoted with the utmost haste. She accommodated our every need without question or hesitation. She also went the extra mile to ensure that our stay was pleasurable and that we had everything that we wanted or needed. Any problem with our accommodation was quickly and effectively remedied by our girl Mihaela. PROMOTE HER!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: southislandgurl
Reviews.Content: Ya, its an older hotel. But its like coming home. staff was nice and friendly, always accommodating to requests. I met lots of staff during my stay, and always acted like we have known eachother for ever. Thanks Tania for taking of care of me at departure, you are particularly wonderful!. Hope to see you all again soon!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Mayailanham
Reviews.Content: This a copy of the email that I sent the managers of the Ramada, just copy and pasting for ease :) So. I booked a reservation for the evening for 4/2/11 about a month ago. My reservation was cancelled due to my card declining (card number I used at the time of reservation was stolen, and therefore cancelled. I believed that I would not be charged until departure, or at least arrival) so ok, my fault I guess. But I'm VERY confused as to how/why I did not receive so much as a quick email informing me of this, in which case it would have quickly been rectified and a new card number given. The front desk woman was extremely rude about this, lied and said that someone had contacted me and that was just an overall terrible experience. But ok, I guess stuff can go wrong sometimes. And then another friend who had booked a room in the same hotel arrived. "Oh, the fire alarm went off and everything in the room that was reserved for you is soaked. You can't stay here." Seriously? Okay. The same front desk woman then proceeded to belittle them a bit, and then found them a room 2 MILES away, for more money. No apologies, no offering of a cab to get there, and a lie about the proximity of the new hotel. It's 8:30 at this point, we have things to do on GRANVILLE, where she had booked a room. And, when I suggested that they get a room at the Howard Johnson across the street where I am staying and know they still have rooms available, the woman behind the desk goes "we already reserved this one for you. Sorry." My friends proceed to trek their way (in a foreign country no less) to the oh so close hotel. They arrive at the Empire Landmark and the gentleman at the front desk has not received the reservation because the evil desk woman at the Ramada has used Expedia and not faxed them, or called them to inform them of the situation. My friend proceeds to call the Ramada and try to figure something out (roaming charges applied) and she asks to speak to the front desk at the Empire. They speak for a bit, nothing is fixed. She refuses to fax anything over (confirmation) and when the phone is handed back to my friend, your front desk woman is on the line screaming profanities. "He's a f***ing idiot, I'm going to come there and slap him" Etc. I have never even heard of such a lack of professionalism. This is 100% unacceptable. All in all, of the 3 rooms booked only 1 was available. Thank you Ramada for ruining what would have been an otherwise great night! By the way, I believe her name started with an "M", brunette, she looked about 35+ and had a bit of an accent.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay here !”
Reviews.Author: Kamalgill
Reviews.Content: I visited Vancouver last week , stayed at ramada inn and suites , splendid hotel, awesomesttt staff ever ! Nicci is simply great and helpful ! This hotel gave me a feeling of Home Away From Home ! Must stay here and make your times memorable ! Keep it up guys , u r all rocking !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GMRamadaSP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find, in a neighborhood full of restaurants and coffee places. Movie theater withing walking distance. The staff was great at the front desk, super friendly, quick and efficient. The room was on the 3rd floor, clean, quiet and well appointed. The single queen bed and the sofa was great for our weekend getaway. Had breakfast in Morrissey the following morning, great food and good price. Overall a great place to stay in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jeffer77
Reviews.Content: Whenever I visit Vancouver I always stay at the Ramada. The hotel is perfect for being centrally located in the downtown area without charging ridiculously overinflated prices. I love being able to step outside and walk to majority of the city's best attractions. If I can't get to it by foot, the skytrain system's are brilliant and they are very accessible. The rooms are always clean and the staff are extremely personable. They recently refreshed all of their rooms so although the building is heritage, it has a very modern feel to it. I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone who loves being in the middle of everything and wants a little something left over in their wallet for that great local designer find or a great meal at one of the hundreds of amazing restaurants the neighbourhood has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel right downtown that is pet friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Vansetter
Reviews.Content: Close to everything - nightlife, transportation etc., pet friendly, reasonable pricing

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!! The colors are fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: firesalamander
Reviews.Content: OMG! I love Love LOVE this hotel!! The carpet is funky and colorful from the lobby, to the stairwell, to the hallways, to the room... a different color at each point! I absolutely loved walking through the hallways to my room, the carpet colors made me smile with the bright yellow, red and blue colors which were tied in very nicely with the wall and trim color. I could imagine myself as a cartoon skipping along :) The staff were super friendly and always took the time to say hello and ask how my stay was going. I didn't ask for housekeeping service during my stay, but the room was nice and clean when I first checked in. The location was great since we travelled by public transit, we were in the center of everywhere we wanted to be.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms- great location!”
Reviews.Author: mjcevallos
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel and would stay again because of fantastic location & friendly staff. Room was quite small, but comfortable. Nice TV and the wireless internet was GREAT! The hotel itself seems very tight. Tight halls, small lobby area- but considering the age of the building, it wasn't a problem. The rooms were remodeled nicely. My only concern was that we had VERY LOUD neighbors on our floor. When people are out in the hall it sounds like they are yelling right at your door. Parking was alright and the price wasn't too high. Overall, this hotel is very decent and within walking distance to a lot of places!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: fragglefish
Reviews.Content: Was quote a specific amount from staff; however, upon arrival the amount was more than doubled as I had forgotten my government ID. Although I had business cards, letter of offer for my position and a banks statement showing my last deposit from the government of BC the staff would not budge on the price; despite allowing another guest to show a pay stub instead of an ID. I could have managed with paying the extra money, as this is their policy; however, I have to say I was extremely disappointed with the attitude I received from the female staff person a the front desk. If the staff were more friendly and helpful I would consider staying here again at the price I was originally quoted; however, the room was not worth the $200+ we had to pay for one night. If we were to pay this price I would much prefer Georgian Court which is also downtown but has rooms and service suited to the $200/night price range. Additionally, we did not have a pet with us but were clearly placed in a 'pet' room as there was dog food on the floor of our room. Sort of makes me wonder how well the rest of the room was cleaned if it wasn't even vacuumed. Long story short; the service needs to be better and the room should match the price.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for........”
Reviews.Author: Mccool044
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights in total. Reception is rude and couldnt careless. They are just there to "do their job" and nothing more. We on the 6th floor (highest) and traffic noise was terrible! even during the week. Lots of police cars and party-goers. "rougher end" of granville Street, but didnt feel unsafe. Dairy (SevenEleven) just down the road which was great. Nice rooms, compact but very clean and modern. Great bathrooms with deep baths. TV recpetion was bad. Even on pay movies was fuzzy. OLD building with the slowest lifts Ive ever used. fustrating. We travelled with two small children and could get a double buggy in the lift but bit of a mission. We asked to leave our bags there (when we went to Vancouver Island, for 3 nights) and they were happy to do this, no charge. However bags are kept behind recpetion, not in a room or lock away, although we had no problems. Bar/Restaurant downstairs is a little dark and gloomy but the staff at the restaurant more than make up for it. Good food. I would not recommend this hotel based on the staff. However for a cheap room in a good location, I would. (But bring your earplugs and ask for a high up room)

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience in this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: travelercanada80
Reviews.Content: I never really used my hotel accommodation with my flight package in this hotel. I just want other travelers to know what transpire and not be it a lesson for everyone. If you travel Canada, you must have credit card with you. And it must have at least 500cnd in it. I checked in Ramada Inn last Feb 10 and they do not accept me there because I cannot present a credit card. They asked 300Cnd deposit. They said all over hotels in Canada charged a deposit. They said they will accept debit/cash but in 500Cnd dol. I do not have that huge money with me. I bought the flight and hotel package at 495Cnd dol and they charged almost the same amount with the plane fare already! I told them how about my husband CC and still they require a personal appearance of the CC. I told her, my husband is in Conklin, Alberta he cannot just pop up just for the a deposit. The conversation took a long time but in the end I end up calling my friend at 12am in cold winter night in Vancouver and begged my friend to stay in their house. My friend even talked with the front desk but about this CC policy. Still with no avail. I asked the bell boy to call me a taxi and I sleep with my friend for 2 nights. It is useless to stay in a hotel that doesn't feel the circumstances of the people. Travelers are tired and exhausted from the flight. But they threw them like a trashed if you cannot pay them deposit via credit card. I am so emotionally drain that I even the thought of it made me shiver and cried. If this is how they promote tourism in Canada by not letting tourists and or travelers to sleep inside the paid room in a hotel because of credit card policy deposits...it's so INHUMANE! What if the travelers doesn't have a friend in the vicinity and or doesn't have money? They will sleep in streets, exhausted and shivering in cold outside. Very Inhumane!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shasha0777
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice overall. The floors were very squeaky. It seems to me an older building. It can use a little renovation. Be careful with parking. They say it's $15 Canadian and it's valet. It's not valet. You just give your keys to the front desk to hold until your ready to use your car. The first day we needed our car we had to wait till the guy at the front desk moved all the cars so that we can get out car out. So park at the end of the parking lot to make things easier. Also with the $15 parking there is a a 30% tax charged to the fee. So it ended up being more like $20 Canadian. But overall, it's a nice hotel and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “depends on the room you get...”
Reviews.Author: MikeAth
Reviews.Content: I checked in late at the hotel. The room they gave me was horrible. It was at the back of the hotel on the ground floor. You could see the back alley of a night club (so I would expect that the room would be dark even in the morning) and the room would shake in the rhythm of the bass coming from the club. Also there was noise coming from the bathroom as water was running in the toilet. I asked the guy at the reception for another room and he told me that I had to stay at that room till the next morning. In the morning, I asked another room at the top floor and luckily they had one. The room there was the total opposite: very clean, nice with a lot of light (see at the photos). The breakfast was not good: they would bring a plate with a fryup to you. The location of the hotel is good. The stuff seemed to be responsive to my requests. In case you stay there, make sure that you stay on a high-floor room, otherwise it could be a very unpleasant experience. Considering the amount of money I paid I expected something better.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you're a hooker turning tricks or the recipient, please do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaxationAccountant
Reviews.Content: I always thought that Ramada stood for quality and service; however, after a recent experience I am beginning to see the real truth. I could not believe that with all its corporate leverage the hotel hones it would allow a nightclub to play unrelenting bass, enough to shake the furniture, until 3am. At the very least, it could have enforced the nightclub to soundproof its premise. After asking for a room-change, I was brushed off with a "we are sold out" statement and a pathetic breakfast offer. What angers me the most is the fact that I knew that not all rooms were being used. This shows management's true integrity and lack thereof. A business that doesn't standup for its guests or itself is a coward. Maybe business school would better help management understand this simple concept. I will be sending a letter to Mark F. Young (Ramada Worldwide President) and Eric A. Danziger (Wyndham Hotel Group President) in more detail of a weakness in their chain. For those in search of a hotel that offers a good night's rest, please look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: SaraJoon77
Reviews.Content: My car was broken into in their parking lot and they refused to do anything about it. The management was not helpful at all when I called them and told them about it, they just told me to go through my insurance company which didn't do me a lot of good since I have to pay a $300 deductible. The hotel was also right on top of a bar and it was really noisy I couldn't sleep all night long. If they offered me a free stay for an entire year I would turn it down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSam81
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! Beautiful rooms, great service and fantastic location. Right beside two skytrains! Didn't have to take any cabs and walking distance to nightlife, amazing food, and trendy Yaletown district! Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: orkeed
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 19 nights and it was absolutely brilliant. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful specially Mihaela at the front desk. I would recommend this hotel because of its quality, the staff and its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fancy_Sally
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel during our honeymoon. Staff was extremely friendly and professional. Would like to make special mention of Mihaela and Sean who were working the night shift during our stay. They were both extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We got a really grea t hookup n the girl at the front michalea hooked us up”
Reviews.Author: natraty
Reviews.Content: Mihaela at the vancouver suites is awesome we really apperciate her help!!

Reviews.Title: “Deal of the century”
Reviews.Author: designerd
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I had to book a last-minute hotel room for a night before our flight out of Vancouver. The Ramada had the best combination of location, price, and comfortable accommodations. Vivian, at the front desk, was cheerful and very helpful. When I return to Vancouver, I will book again at the Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lc_2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week and enjoyed - the location is really nice with easy access to bus, train, shuttle, etc.; and the frontdesk staff are always very helpful, especially Ms Corinna.

Reviews.Title: “4th and last stay, its keeps going downhill”
Reviews.Author: gottagetoutofhereBc
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay and my last. Customer service at the front desk lacks. the rooms reaked of pot, they were run down, the food in the attached pub was really bad, I could go on and on. It a great location being that it is downtown, but in the end you get what you pay for. Also there has always been a problem with homeless people and drugs in this area but it just seems to get worse every year. If you are just looking for a place tio crash and don't mind wearing ear plugs at night then it will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “It seems that you can never get a straight story from one person there”
Reviews.Author: ezza24
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Ramada downtown due to the location and wanting to have a nice weekend. We called ahead to ask what the total price of our trip will be and it was just under $300 for three nights. We have a dog so we asked them to include that price plus taxes. We were told over the phone that for our dog it is $20 total plus having a credit card on file. We were happy with the $300 price and was budgeting our trip accordingly. When we arrive they informed us that it was actually $20 a night for our pet. We explained that they had told us it would be $20 total and the girl simply replied "well it's not." We then settled with that and then when she went to charge us she stated that there is also a $15 pernight plus parking tax plus hst on top of the final price for parking and that they have a valet parking system and it is in a secure lot. We explained that we had not been advised of this and how we had been told a certain price. Again we were told "well it's what policy is, I can't do anything." By this time we were made as we had already paid over $80 of what they had stated. I realize this may not seem like much but this was a big holiday for us and that is a lot of money. We paid upfront when we checked in so that we knew how much money we had left over. When we checked out they slapped us with ANOTHER $70 bill stating we hadn't paid for the parking. I told her we had paid for it when we checked in and she just said "no you didn't." After sitting there with the receipts she finally let it go but made a point of saying how much of a favor she was giving us. The room was very plain and either very cold or very warm. The only really good thing about it was the breakfast which was served by the pub next door. I might have considered coming back again had the service not been terrible and it seemed like people knew what they were talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Falls Short on Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: dwilanix
Reviews.Content: This Ramada is conveniently located and offered a family suite in downtown Vancouver - perfect for a family of five. The shortfall for us was when our belongings were stolen. There was no sign of forced entry - odd. We felt certain that we had pulled the door shut behind us. When we returned after a day of sight-seeing, my 10 year-old pulled a pair of men's running shoes out of his bag. We then realized that all of our bags were dishevelled and of course, my husband's shoes were gone. We immediately notified the front desk. They were horrified and rushed to our room looking confused and speechless... Long story short... the kids were afraid and felt violated but the hotel DID NOT give us a new room. They said that they were booked up, but I am wondering why they could not switch our room with another family that had not yet arrived? We would have been satisfied with two double beds and a cot. The next morning, the maid came by and questioned whether this was our room. She then told us that she had let someone else in the day before and rushed off to tell her supervisor. When she returned, she had completely changed her story and wondered how someone had gotten into a locked room. We notified the front desk and the police. In the end, the Ramada paid for only half of our stay. They never did give us a different room nor a coupon for another stay! They gave us two day's worth of free breakfast coupons for a not-so-good restaurant next door... but it seems that all of the guests were getting these coupons! The police file is still open and we have received no correspondence from this major chain. Making us happy would have been very easy. I feel that because we didn't yell or make a big scene, our situation was not viewed as a major concern. BUT, I am glad to spread the word here and now and perhaps other families will think twice before booking at the Ramada on Granville in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and convenient place with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hotel123456
Reviews.Content: Ramada Inn was within my budget and in downton close by to everything. The staff (esp Dorsa) was very helpful in guiding to visit different places in and around vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,WiFi,Reasonable Price and excellence service”
Reviews.Author: MLYK
Reviews.Content: Front desk agent , Ms Vivian is very friendly and helplful. Walking distance to downtown shopping centre, A bus stop infront of the hotel and bus number 50 can reach Graville Island. Yaletown train station is very near to the hotel. We enjoyed the stayed in this hotel with good location, price reasonable and WiFi. ML Singapore 4 Dec 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sergioledesma2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is closed to the Yaletown train station. Bars, clubs, restaurant, stores are just outside the hotel. Front desk agent at the desk really friendly and cute.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: studzy
Reviews.Content: Being a traveller, not much amazes me anymore. The service from the front desk staff, Vivian and Paloma was beyond anything that I have ever experienced! From storing two huge Japanese instruments (Kotos) and the graciousness of all that they did to make the stay memorable - thank you! So often the only people I communicate with when staying in a hotel is the front desk staff - what a nice way to start a business trip. The rooms were great, but the staff were fabulous! So ladies, tell your bosses to give you a raise! Thank you for making an otherwise dull trip truly fabulous! With regards, /M.D.V.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful front desk staff and a great room!”
Reviews.Author: niastate
Reviews.Content: It was a quick trip to Vancouver and we were warmly welcomed by Sean and well cared for by Corimra & Ragiv. EVERYONE we encountered at the front desk was gracious and exceptionally willing to offer outstanding service to meet our needs. Great price, delightful staff, great suite. I'll stay there again! (Affordable prices too.)

Reviews.Title: “excellent people in services”
Reviews.Author: ahmedsamy1972
Reviews.Content: actually it is amazing place the manger mr sean he is very lovely gentelman who realy understand how to serve his customers and also other work staff such as mr rajiv , mr edo , ms vivian all were great people who realy dedcated them selves to serve their customers , so , thanks every one as i was planing to stay for 10 days but now i am staying for more than one month again thanks and i engoyed my accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: lordbob
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night but it was a good night. Front desk staff were friendly, open and knowledgeable. Room was clean, bed was extremely comfortable. The view was a bit limited but I came there to sleep and relax and at those ends the hotel met and exceeded my standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for first time visitors”
Reviews.Author: Alibbc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 days...I was in Vancouver to have surgery and I stayed at the Ramada for recovery...I found all the staff friendly and caring. I would like to thank Dorsa at the front desk for being an excellent host.

Reviews.Title: “Several limitations, but good value for price”
Reviews.Author: cqfp123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights while attending a convention. Room faced back of building. Pros: Excellent downtown location, reasonable room/bathroom size and amenities (coffee maker, large screen TV, toiletries), very comfortable bed, complimentary WiFi throughout the hotel, friendly staff, complimentary passes to excellent Steve Nash Fitness World around the corner, good value for price. Cons: Squeaky floors (mine and the one above, quite noisy and annoying), no refrigerator or safe in room, elevator card reader working poorly (always requiring multiple attempts), cleanliness could be better (found hair in room and bathroom).

Reviews.Title: “upsetting appearance and presentation”
Reviews.Author: CharlieG_10
Reviews.Content: We were disturbed after staying in other Ramada hotels to find a Hotel of lesser standard. The corridors smelt of urine and on returning to the lifts found dog excretia on the lift floor. Our room was tidy however was at the back of the hotel and the only view was dirty concrete walls. This Hotel had no concierge service and you were virtually on your own to find out city information. The standard of Hotel guests seemed to be transient people moving to the city for work. The location was reasonable however in the worse part of town. Very unhappy with our stay and would have stayed elsewhere if we had not prepaid.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms, nice furnishings, but busy street and beggers”
Reviews.Author: dazed912
Reviews.Content: Our trip was medical not leisure. We stayed here for 2 nights in July of a planned 1 week stay. The staff were friendly but there seemed to be a lack of a doorman or help with luggage. Also I was asked for cigarettes or change by 8 different individuals while having a smoke outside in the first 48 hours of being there. We decided to checkout and move to another hotel and when loading our van with our luggage we saw that someone had decided to use the parking lot as there bathroom. The issue does not appear to be the hotels, but rather the city police and the area. The rooms although large and well furnished had zero view of anything due to the buildings low number of floors. If I was Ramada I would try to make a better name by ditching this location and finding or building a 10 + story hotel. Oh also the elevator broke so i had to use the stairs and my daughter was not able to walk yet again so we had to carry her.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a non smoking room”
Reviews.Author: oysterfiend
Reviews.Content: We requested a non smoking room. All the literature says if there is evidence of you smoking $250 will be debited from you Credit Card. On arrival after our cruise we entered our room and it Stank of old mouldy smoking smells. Absolutely unacceptable to non smokers and rather ironical considering their well published policy. Musty smells in corridor and awkward fire doors to get through- the buildings are old. However the room we exchanged into was fine and good value for what we paid. 1 free internet computer at reception- always people waiting to use it. Location is good and if you rooms smells okay it is good value for the price. If you want flash and room service this is not it, but it was clean and adequate at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “the greatest guest staff around”
Reviews.Author: adc4u4me
Reviews.Content: great room awesome locat1on and the best hotel staff

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Gladous
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot over my life,and stayed at many hotels..motels..villas..resorts...I would like to think i am a pretty good judge of a good place to stay.The Ramada was accommodating right from the get-go! i called in last minute and it was not a problem,i spoke with there front desk girl Corinna,i could feel her smile through the phone as she answer all my questions and offered advice on the city.I arrived late and all i wanted was to get in to bed and catch up what sleep i had lost.there was no wait.The complimentary breakfast was superb, and with great access to the city by just walking out the hotel lobby doors.. Thanks guys !! hope to be back soon to visit my friends at the Ramada,highly recommend to any travelers

Reviews.Title: “run down and at best, only good for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinMadrid
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be quite run down and best, only good for an overnight stay. This is a pretty basic hotel with minimal benefits, for example, no room service. The rooms are very small and while the bathroom was recently updated, the rest was rough around the edges. Seeing stains on the sheets while trying to figure out why I was itchy during the night (let you come to your own conclusions on why I was doing that) was enough to make me want to check out right then.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Central”
Reviews.Author: donalddbhu
Reviews.Content: If you consider staying in this establishment I would suggest that you request a room on the 5th or 6th floor as there is a nightclub attached to the building and it could be noisey in you were any lower, especially on Friday and Saturday nights. The staff were friendly and helpful. I was in a suite on the 6th floor and it had 2 x 42" LCD TV's! and it was very comfortable. The hotel is central to anywhere in downtown Vancouver and I walked my feet off! No need for buses or trams.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jcann
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is the location. You can walk to Granville Island in 10 minutes and to City Centre / Gastown / Waterfront in 20. A word of warning, do not try to walk over the bridge to Granville, get directions and use the ferry. Also buy a $9 per day travel pass, it covers bus, tram, skytrain and some ferries. There are frequent services from just outside the hotel. The decor of the hotel is a bit tired and rundown. The rooms are variable, some have fridges, some do not. They are all fairly comfortable, but if you are on the front and low down you do get traffic noise. Worse still on Friday and Saturday nights there is a nightclub nearby which operates until 3am. I am told that sleep in these rooms is almost impossible. We had breakfast in the hotel, it was adequate rather than good. The attached Pub is OK but there are smarter and cheaper ones nearby. Another major plus are the reception staff, they are efficient and helpful. If you can get this hotel for a reasonable rate and avoud the low floor front rooms, the great location more than makes up for the other shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Minala
Reviews.Content: Located in good location on main thoroughfare (Granville Street). Within walking distance of all major Vancouver sites. Right down the street from the bridge to Granville Island. Because of the location there is lots of activity late into the evening. Can be a bit noisy due to outside activity. Also if you like complete darkness to sleep well (as I do) found this difficult as light from outside (street lights and neon signs) difficult to block. Would definitely request a room that does not face Granville the next time. Also heard noise from hallway. Felt that rooms could have been cleaned better. Found hair from previous guests in bathroom and carpeting in need of vacuum. Staff were very helpful though. Although hotel has no fitness center guests are provided with free passes to Steve Nash Fitness Center located around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, a nice hotel in a brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: smicer07
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 2 week trip to Vancouver. The Ramada Inn Downtown was our first stop and we were overally very pleased with the hotel. Positives Quite cheap Free Internet. Great location, close to shops and other attractions Big room with a nice bathroom, good toiletries and shower. Big comfortable bed. Nice staff and easy check-in. Negatives Noise in the night from the local nightclub on Friday and Saturday. Could feel the vibrations! We weren't even near the club either! Although the location is very good, there are a few sex shops and beggars close to the front of the hotel- although I think you'd find this in any big city to be honest, and it didn't bother us. Overall, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Location, Sleep Quality, Service and Cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: ljbeinc
Reviews.Content: Arrive in Vancouver by Bus from Seattle and planned to stay for five nights. Not having a clue as to where one hotel was in relation to the downtown area and having the need to be nearby to the Hyatt (for a convention) but without having to pay the prices of the Hyatt and being a stickler for cleanliness and a dark, quiet room while I sleep, I felt really lucky to find a room at the Ramada on Granville Street in Vancouver. We were placed in a middle room which took care of the darkness but, above all, they initially said they had only double rooms but after my husband had a hard time fitting on the bed lengthwise (he is almost 6-1/2 feet tall), we requested and Mihaela and Sean went above and beyond to search and find us a king-size room for the remaining four nights we were at the Hotel. We were amazed at the rate and the location compared to other hotels in the area. It is located smack in the center of Vancouver's entertainment district. It is close to restaurants, shops, nail and hair salons, food stores, etc. Everything you need is within walking distance and the bus system has service just as you step out of the hotel. We are pleased to HIGHLY recommend this hotel and the special services of Mihaela and Sean.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianKathryn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, not too far from the train station and an easy walk from Yaletown (a really busy and popular restaurant/bar area). It was easily accessible and would be easy to get to Granville Island and back from there. It is, indeed, a bit run-down. The hallways are the worst part -- musty-smelling and really ugly carpet -- but inside, the rooms are actually quite nice. The beds were very comfortable. The people working at the front desk were very nice, and happy to help, although they didn't seem terribly knowledgeable; there were several people correcting each other when I asked for information on local busses, and they were unable to help another customer who asked about fishing tours. There were several downsides to the hotel, however. We requested a crib for our three-month-old and were brought a foldaway playpen (like a Pack'N'Play), which was fine, but we had to supply our own sheets for it. We had made some special requests (like paying extra to have a very late check-in) which were only sort of accommodated, but I still felt like the staff were doing their best to help us. I think they were hampered by being a bit understaffed at the front desk, and not having good communication between each other and with the management. The suite was fine, too, and we were very glad to have the dishes and the microwave. The TVs were quite nice, and the bathrooms were bright and nice. Cleanlines was fine, no major problems, but there were definitely hairs on the windowsill and in the tub when we arrived. Overall, it was absolutely fine for what we needed, and since we got a very good price for downtown Vancouver, I'm not going to complain. I would indeed recommend it to friends but only if they got a good price on it!

Reviews.Title: “'...good in parts...'”
Reviews.Author: markw_bd
Reviews.Content: Like the proverbial curate's egg, this hotel is good in parts. First the good bits.... The fastest Wi-Fi I've ever enjoyed in a hotel. And it's free! Good one. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly, and helpful. The not so good bits... Although the rooms look like they've been refurbished the common areas are very shabby, and the bathrooms (although clean) could use some work. The breakfast is pretty dire - and served by almost sitcom comedy waitresses - careful you don't ask for more! You'll be better off eating out. The location is Downtown - emphasis on the 'down'. If you are looking for heavy drinking and rowdiness it will be perfect, but you may find it makes for a disturbed night. So a bit mixed. Consider exactly what you want before booking. And to reinforce other reviews, yes they do have the most gorgeous receptionist in Mihaela I've seen in a Hotel! :))

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Megan018
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now and have always had a good night's rest- even though the building is older, the beds are super comfortable and it certainly is value for money.... The real reason for my review however is to say a big THANK YOU to two of the staff members....I feel like you guys went above and beyond to help post my belongings to me and for that I am so very grateful!!!! Keep up the excellent customer service as that is what really sets one place apart from another!

Reviews.Title: “I had a great experience with Ramada, for sure i'll be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmc001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ramada in the first week of June. The location was perfect as it was close to everything from shopping to entertainment. The hotel has a warm feeling to it with newly renovated rooms, free internet , convenient parking and some of the friendliest staff I have experienced. At the front desk I was greeted by a gorgeous girl Mihaela who was very helpful with directions and information about available tours. Even thought the hotels is ranked as a three star facility , I felt treated better then in many 5 star hotels. The free passes at the Gym are an excellent addition to the many amenities. I would recomend this hotel because of friendly staff, perfect location , courteous wake up call , valet parking and personalized service. The elevator was a little bit slow , but for a guy like me who needs a workout I loved the stairs everytime I rushed to my room. On the up side if you want a quiet room , you can always request a higher floor. If you are a party kind of person , the noise will not be a factor as you will be offered no coverage and no wait in line to the Ginger 62 Club. I will definately come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Jimjr2
Reviews.Content: I was trying too stay within a certain budget for my latest trip too VANCOUVER an the RAMADA INN downtown meet that first requirement. I then checked on the website an saw that the HOTEL had been renovated BUT still was a bit apprehensive about staying at this particular INN. MY main concerns were the parking and the loudness of the BANDS playing during the nighttime as I am a light sleeper. WELL those concerns totally evaporated once I made it too my room at the INN. UPON checking in, i did check in late, the front clerk staff could not have been any friendlier or more helpful with my checkin. I was advised that since I was checking in late my pre-arranged room, 608, had already been taken BUT FOR just the one night. The following morning I was able too move up too 608, with the help of house keeping staff, at my leisure. Once i was settled in my room for my first nights stay, room 402, I found that the room was great. IT had everything one could ask for an then some. A well appointed, clean room, great TV, an super great bathroom. I also found that the room, which faceD onto GRANVILLE Street was quiet even when the BAND started playing in the lounge area of the INN. I have too say that from the HOTEL DESK MANAGER right through too the HOUSE CLEANING STAFF they made my stay at this INN one of the best and most memoralbe I have had in VANCOUVER BC in a long long time. WOULD MOST HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel too ONE AN ALL. WAS TREATED like part of the family and the staff went out of their way to ensure that the lest query or concern, from myself an other INN guests, was dealt with immediately an very very efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Granville”
Reviews.Author: Christina00710
Reviews.Content: I stayed with the Ramada Inn & Suites -Downtown Vancouver just recently and was not totally impressed. During check in was not told about any of the amenites and was rushed through the process even though there was no line, had to call to the front desk later and ask. It was not listed that there was a $.50 telephone connection fee everytime you go to place a call also was not told at check in about the $15.00 parking fee, which is to be expected when staying downtown but it's nice to know. My poor experiences can really just come down to one employee at check in and out and her poor demeanor. Management seemed to be helpful and friendly , and the gentelman on the night staff was very helpful and pleasant. If you don't like answering travellers what may seem to be dumb to you questions then customer service is obviously not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location - mixed use and vibrant inner city”
Reviews.Author: remsonia
Reviews.Content: [+] Super location - walkable distance to the downtown, trendy areas, Robson Square (shopping & dining), the art museum, and Vancouver's world-class public transit! As a younger person, I am attracted to vibrant and interesting neighborhoods with character, and there was plenty of it. There are bars and clubs nearby. The rooms themselves were very clean and beds were comfortable. Their staff were very nice and helpful. One gentleman was on the verge of leaving at the end of his shift, but still helped out with a question. [-] The room was a bit small, but that could be expected from a downtown location. It lacked a fridge and the hairdryer did not work. This end of Granville is a little more seedy, so there were some sketchy people roaming around the convenience stores looking for "tips." It was often loud at night: there was a guy shouting profanities for at least an hour one night! Check-in person did not tell us about the voucher for breakfast - doh! Would likely stay at this location in the future because of the positives!

Reviews.Title: “Your average run of the mill, generic, nothing special Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cpj79
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad hotel, some of the reviews here are a little harsh in my opinion, but it’s not a good hotel either. It is your average run of the mill, generic, nothing special Ramada. I have stayed here twice, thanks to the pot luck of Priceline, and both times the hotel is at best, unremarkable. The hotel itself is not located in the nicest part of downtown Vancouver, you will walk around with that feeling you are about to be mugged or see a drive by shooting. So when I left my car there on my first visit, I was a little concerned! When it comes to the rooms themselves they are your average cheap hotel room. The TV did not work in my room during my stay, the elevator is old and slow, shower does it best to dribble warm water over you but the bed is comfy and the room is clean. They do need to sound proof the walls the though, the first night of my visit, I was keep awake until 4am by some guy laughing and talking (Should someone talking in another room really keep you awake?) and On a side note, this hotel does hold a personal record though. For me, it holds the record of having the WORST view from a hotel window that I have every stayed in (The 10 foot wide light well in the middle of the building). However the biggest redeeming feature of this hotel is its staff. They were on both visits, the most friendly, polite nicest staff members that I think I have seen in a hotel for a long time. To sum up – you can do better, much much better in Vancouver in terms of cheap hotels in a good location. If you do end up here, you probably will not remember much about your visit other than keep telling yourself, why you continue to use average Ramada hotels, when there are so many other better options?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a central Location”
Reviews.Author: boomers_boy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in April for a week. The hotel represented great value, the rooms were very clean and looked very new and fresh although slightly small, however free wifi throughout the hotel was awesome as some hotels make you pay extra for that. The service was brilliant everyone was really friendly and helpful with directions etc getting around the city. The hotel is located at the bottom of granville street so it was easy to walk everywhere in the city and the skytrain station is only a few blocks away if you want to venture a bit further out of the city into greater Vancouver. The area outside the hotel is a little dingy but I didn't feel unsafe at any point. Theres a 7eleven store accross the road an a liqour store very close also and then is very conveniently located for a night out in the entertainment district area of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “clean 2 star hotel in rundown part of granville street”
Reviews.Author: julieannboo
Reviews.Content: clean 2 star hotel but in rundown part of granville. got approached by homeless people as soon as we left hotel for spare change on first day. they are harmless though. stayed on 2nd floor - didn't hear any noise from pub downstairs but plumbing in bathroom was nosiey. also could hear doors slamming so walls were paper thin. very clean rooms and powerful shower. coffee house next door and a seven 11 on street corner.
